unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gathers Pace Across India**
normalised: Smart Meter Rollout Gathers Pace Across India

unnormalised: New Delhi, October 26, 2023 – The nationwide rollout of smart meters is gaining momentum, with significant installations reported across several states. Power Grid Corporation of India Ltd. (PGCIL) announced reaching a milestone of 500,000 smart meter installations in Uttar Pradesh by 18/12/2023, aiming for complete coverage by 2025.
normalised: New Delhi, October twenty six, two thousand and twenty three – The nationwide rollout of smart meters is gaining momentum, with significant installations reported across several states. Power Grid Corporation of India L T D. (P G C I L) announced reaching a milestone of five hundred thousand smart meter installations in Uttar Pradesh by eighteenth december two thousand and twenty three, aiming for complete coverage by two thousand and twenty five.

unnormalised: The initiative, designed to reduce Aggregate Technical and Commercial (AT&C) losses, is receiving positive feedback from consumers in pilot programs in cities like Varanasi and Jaipur. Early data indicates improved billing accuracy and enhanced transparency.
normalised: The initiative, designed to reduce Aggregate Technical and Commercial (A T and C) losses, is receiving positive feedback from consumers in pilot programs in cities like Varanasi and Jaipur. Early data indicates improved billing accuracy and enhanced transparency.

unnormalised: “Smart meters are a crucial step towards modernizing our electricity grid and empowering consumers,” stated Mr. Sharma, Secretary, Ministry of Power, during a press briefing at 11:00 hrs. on 25/10/2023. Concerns regarding data privacy and cybersecurity are being addressed with stringent security protocols. The next phase, scheduled to commence at 14:00 hrs on 01/11/2023, will focus on integrating renewable energy sources seamlessly into the grid, further enhancing its efficiency and resilience. Discoms are expecting a reduction of Rs. 2000 crores in theft losses.
